alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Robertson; Sumner; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:04AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Davidson, Sumner, northwestern Wilson and eastern Robertson Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 204 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cross Plains to near Joelton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gallatin, Lebanon, Springfield, Hendersonville, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Coopertown, Westmoreland, Ridgetop, Cross Plains, Portland, Joelton, Orlinda, Mitchellville, Bethpage, Oak Grove and Bledsoe Creek State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 95 and 120. Interstate 24 between mile markers 32 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
